article_node.title: Even at an All-Time High, The Vanguard S&P 500 ETF Isn't as Expensive as It Seems
article_node.summary: The Vanguard S&P 500 ETF, the largest fund tracking the S&P 500, has seen significant price appreciation, raising concerns about its valuation relative to earnings growth. Despite a forward P/E ratio of 22.2, which is above historical averages, the article argues that the S&P 500's valuation may be justified due to increased efficiency and the growing influence of high-growth companies, particularly in technology. Additionally, the Vanguard Growth ETF has outperformed the S&P 500 over the past decade, driven by a concentration in key sectors like technology and consumer discretionary, suggesting that growth-focused investments may continue to yield strong returns.
